title: Order of Volatility Quiz
description: Quiz covering the order of volatility for different types of data.

questions.text: Arrange the following data types in order of volatility, from most volatile to least volatile:
itemOrder: Routing Table, ARP cache, Process Table, Kernel Statistics, Memory
questions.explanation: The order of volatility is: 1) Registers, Cache; 2) Routing Table, ARP cache, Process Table, Kernel Statistics, Memory; 3) Temporary File systems; 4) Disk; 5) Remote Logging/Monitoring Data; 6) Physical Configuration, Network Topology; 7) Archival Media.

questions.text: Which of the following data types is the most volatile?
questions.explanation: Registers and Cache are the most volatile, as they lose their data when power is removed.

questions.text: Archival media is the most volatile type of data.
questions.explanation: Archival media is the least volatile type of data.

questions.text: Which of the following data types is typically collected first during incident response?
questions.explanation: Registers, Cache are the most volatile and should be collected first.

questions.text: Which of the following data types is considered non-volatile?
The order of volatility is important for preserving evidence during incident response.
questions.explanation: The order of volatility is important for preserving evidence during incident response.
